New Records: Jordan Poole becomes the 1st player in Washington Wizards history to have 5+ 3PM in 5 straight games.
Key Match Events: Jordan Poole scored 30 points to lead the Washington Wizards to a 125-107 win over the Chicago Bulls.
Jordan Poole made his return to the Wizards lineup after missing two games with a hip injury.
Rookie Alexandre Sarr logged 11 points, 10 rebounds, and a season-high-tying five assists.
Zach LaVine led all scorers with 32 points for the Chicago Bulls.
Kyshawn George buried a 3-pointer to stretch the Wizards’ lead to 16 points and later pushed the lead to 20 points with a dunk.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Washington Wizards shot 49.5 percent from the field, making 17 of 36 attempts from 3-point range.
Chicago Bulls shot 44.6 percent from the field and 29.8 percent from 3-point range.
Chicago outrebounded Washington 44-42 but turned the ball over 20 times, leading to being outscored 33-11 in points off turnovers.
